content:
• Thursday, February 9, 2012
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST) drops after its FQ3 misses on EPS and revenue estimates,...

    Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST) drops after its FQ3 misses on EPS and revenue estimates, reporting a net loss of $0.03 on revenue of $27.5M. Street estimates were for a loss of $0.02 on $29M. Shares -8.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • HALO

    Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO) falls 4.3% AH after filing to sell 6.8M shares, good for...

    Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO) falls 4.3% AH after filing to sell 6.8M shares, good for proceeds of $74.8M based on today's close. Halozyme, which in October announced positive results for its breast cancer treatment, says it will use partly use the proceeds to "build commercial inventory for anticipated product launches," and to fund its R&D efforts.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM
  • BRKS

    More on Brooks Automation (NASDAQ:BRKS): FQ1 beats on its EPS as an 87% Y/Y drop in the...

    More on Brooks Automation (NASDAQ:BRKS): FQ1 beats on its EPS as an 87% Y/Y drop in the semiconductor-equipment maker's product revenue was offset by gains in service revenue and better margins. The company also issued an upbeat forcast for the current quarter, now expecting to earn $0.15 - $0.20 per share on revenue of $132M - $140M. Street estimates are for $0.09 per share on revenue of $128M. Shares +6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • TRLG

    More on True Religion's Q4: International sales were flat Y/Y, a drastic change from Q3's 30%...

    More on True Religion's Q4: International sales were flat Y/Y, a drastic change from Q3's 30% increase. U.S. wholesale revenue fell 20% Y/Y, slightly worse than Q3's 18% drop. Gross margin fell 70 bps Q/Q to 64.1%. True Religion is guiding for 2012 sales of $450M-$460M and EPS of $1.88-$1.95, below a consensus of $494.4M and $2.37. TRLG -21.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM
  • TRLG

    True Religion Apparel (NASDAQ:TRLG): Q4 EPS of $0.62 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $119.4M (+7.7%...

    True Religion Apparel (NASDAQ:TRLG): Q4 EPS of $0.62 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $119.4M (+7.7% Y/Y) misses by $9M. Shares -21.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM
  • FX

    Electronic currency exchange FX Alliance (NYSE:FX) closes its first trading day at $13.74, up...

    Electronic currency exchange FX Alliance (NYSE:FX) closes its first trading day at $13.74, up 14.5% from an IPO price of $12. The company, typically referred to as FXall, estimates it generated 2011 revenue of $117.5M-$118.5M (up about 19% Y/Y) and net income of $25.6M-$26.4M. FXall claims 57 S&P Global 100 members are among its 1,000+ clients. (previously) (S-1).

     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM
  • STMP

    Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP): Q4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $27.2M (+19.8% Y/Y) beats...

    Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP): Q4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $27.2M (+19.8% Y/Y) beats by $0.6M. Shares -3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +7%), which rallied today along with other solar names, falls 1.2% AH after...

    First Solar (FSLR +7%), which rallied today along with other solar names, falls 1.2% AH after disclosing the DOE hasn't yet provided initial funding for a 230MW California solar project that First Solar sold to Exelon (NYSE:EXC) for $75M. If funding doesn't arrive by Feb. 24, First Solar could be on the hook to repurchase the project for its initial price, plus costs incurred by Exelon. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM
  • SWIR

    Sierra Wireless (NASDAQ:SWIR): Q4 EPS of $0.08 in-line. Revenue of $147.2M (-12% Y/Y) in-line....

    Sierra Wireless (NASDAQ:SWIR): Q4 EPS of $0.08 in-line. Revenue of $147.2M (-12% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +10.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM

    Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC): FQ2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.03. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)

    Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC): FQ2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.03. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 2 Comments

    PharMerica (NYSE:PMC): Q4 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $495.6M (+0.8% Y/Y) misses by...

    PharMerica (NYSE:PMC): Q4 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $495.6M (+0.8% Y/Y) misses by $10M. Shares +3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • KBH

    The rally in KB Home (KBH +9.7%) today coincided with an SEC filing indicating that...

    The rally in KB Home (KBH +9.7%) today coincided with an SEC filing indicating that investment firm BlackRock had recently increased its KBH holdings to 7.2M, a 9.3% stake. The move extended the stock’s YTD gain to 78% and moving it closer to a golden cross; DHI and BZH are other large home builders already reaching that level.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ3 EPS of -$0.01 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.12....

    Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ3 EPS of -$0.01 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.12. Revenue of $323M (-23.6% Y/Y) misses by $40M. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM

    LeapFrog Enterprises (NYSE:LF): Q4 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $210M (+10.7% Y/Y)...

    LeapFrog Enterprises (NYSE:LF): Q4 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $210M (+10.7% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Shares -8.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • KONA

    Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $23.1M (+9.2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $23.1M (+9.2% Y/Y) beats by $0.9M. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • XIDEQ

    More on Exide Technologies' FQ3: Unit volumes for the aftermarket car battery business fell 13%...

    More on Exide Technologies' FQ3: Unit volumes for the aftermarket car battery business fell 13% Y/Y, contributing to Exide's top-line miss. Moreover, Exide warns it expects FY12 operating income to be less than previously forecast, due to poor auto and industrial battery sales, and it won't provide specific guidance for the forseeable future. Exide also had a disappointing earnings report in November. XIDE -19.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • XIDEQ

    Exide Technologies (XIDE): FQ3 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $784.1M (-2% Y/Y) misses...

    Exide Technologies (XIDE): FQ3 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $784.1M (-2% Y/Y) misses by $60M. Shares -19.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • DMND

    As investors dumped Diamond Foods (DMND -36.9%) stock, a surprising number of traders took to...

    As investors dumped Diamond Foods (DMND -36.9%) stock, a surprising number of traders took to the options market today to play for a rebound. The heaviest single-day trading on record in DMND puts and calls was split about evenly between bullish and bearish contracts, as plenty were willing to speculate that the accounting woes and related problems are surmountable.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 10 Comments
  • CBB

    Cincinnati Bell (NYSE:CBB): Q4 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $365M (+0.7% Y/Y)...

    Cincinnati Bell (NYSE:CBB): Q4 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $365M (+0.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +4.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM

    Carbonite (NASDAQ:CARB): Q4 EPS of -$0.21 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $17.3M (+49.1% Y/Y)...

    Carbonite (NASDAQ:CARB): Q4 EPS of -$0.21 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $17.3M (+49.1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.7% AH. (PR)

  • BRKS

    Brooks Automation (NASDAQ:BRKS): FQ1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $120.2M (-32.6%...

    Brooks Automation (NASDAQ:BRKS): FQ1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $120.2M (-32.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks soared today - FSLR +7%, SPWR +12.5%, TSL +18.6%, YGE +20.4, STP +8.6% - perhaps...

    Solar stocks soared today - FSLR +7%, SPWR +12.5%, TSL +18.6%, YGE +20.4, STP +8.6% - perhaps due to a Deutsche Bank note suggesting that demand is increasing, as evident in rising utilization of solar module factories. But solar has been moving for a few weeks, and some analysts think it's all about short covering.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 5 Comments
  • GSVC

    GSV Capital (NASDAQ:GSVC) - taking advantage of the moonshot in its stock thanks to its holdings...

    GSV Capital (NASDAQ:GSVC) - taking advantage of the moonshot in its stock thanks to its holdings of social media companies, including one named Facebook - announces a secondary offering of 3M shares. Shares -9.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • EXPE

    More on Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE): Q4 beat on EPS but misses on the revenue side as rising average...

    More on Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE): Q4 beat on EPS but misses on the revenue side as rising average ticket prices, changes in its hotel product mix and competitive pricing pressures negatively impacted bottom line margins. Shares -7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • NUAN

    More on Nuance's FQ1: Company attributes shortfall to "delayed revenues" from some mobile...

    More on Nuance's FQ1: Company attributes shortfall to "delayed revenues" from some mobile customers (Apple?). Deferred revenue rose 8% Q/Q to $299.4M. Nuance guides in prepared remarks (.pdf) for FQ2 revenue of $395M-$415M and EPS of $0.36-$0.42 (consensus of $404.5M and $0.38). Guides for FY12 revenue of $1.66B-$1.71B and EPS of $1.55-$1.62 (consensus of $1.68B and $1.60). NUAN -8.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • NXPI

    NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI): Q4 EPS of $0.24 in-line. Revenue of $931M (-13.6% Y/Y). Shares...

    NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI): Q4 EPS of $0.24 in-line. Revenue of $931M (-13.6% Y/Y). Shares +5.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATVI

    Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI): Q4 EPS of $0.62 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $2.41B (-5.4% Y/Y) beats by...

    Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI): Q4 EPS of $0.62 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $2.41B (-5.4% Y/Y) beats by $210M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • GDI

    Gardner Denver (NYSE:GDI): Q4 EPS of $1.54 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $613.7M (+15.8% Y/Y)...

    Gardner Denver (NYSE:GDI): Q4 EPS of $1.54 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $613.7M (+15.8% Y/Y) misses by $16M. Shares -7.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • MSFT

    More on LinkedIn's Q4: Hiring Solutions (job postings) revenue +136% Y/Y, 50% of total revenue....

    More on LinkedIn's Q4: Hiring Solutions (job postings) revenue +136% Y/Y, 50% of total revenue. Marketing Solutions (ads) +77%, 30% of total. Premium Subscriptions +87%, 20% of total. 67% of revenue from U.S., even with Q3. Registered users rose at least 14% Q/Q to over 150M. Sales & marketing spending +158% Y/Y to $53.2M (nearly a third of revenue). LNKD +4.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • EXPE

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE): Q4 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $787M (+6.7% Y/Y) misses by...

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE): Q4 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $787M (+6.7% Y/Y) misses by $24M. Shares -7.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • NUAN

    Nuance Communications (NASDAQ:NUAN): FQ1 EPS of $0.34 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $360.6M...

    Nuance Communications (NASDAQ:NUAN): FQ1 EPS of $0.34 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $360.6M (+20.4% Y/Y) misses by $31M. Shares -8.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $167.7M (+105% Y/Y) beats by $8M....

    LinkedIn (LNKD): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $167.7M (+105% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Expects Q1 revenue of $170M-$175M vs. $170.8M consensus. Expects 2012 revenue of $840M-$860M, better than $828.2M consensus. Shares +3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 5 Comments
  • HNGR

    Hanger Orthopedic (HGR +4.7%) finishes the day solidly in the green after beating Q4 estimates...

    Hanger Orthopedic (HGR +4.7%) finishes the day solidly in the green after beating Q4 estimates earlier. Revenue rose 9% Y/Y on strength from recent acquisitions. The company also raised full-year revenue guidance above Wall Street consensus, now expecting to earn $970M - $990M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • ITMN

    InterMune (NASDAQ:ITMN): Q4 EPS of -$0.69 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $7.81M (-96.8% Y/Y)...

    InterMune (NASDAQ:ITMN): Q4 EPS of -$0.69 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $7.81M (-96.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • S

    Following Sprint's (S -1.7%) earnings release yesterday, Credit Suisse now expects the carrier...

    Following Sprint's (S -1.7%) earnings release yesterday, Credit Suisse now expects the carrier to report a combined loss of 364,000 contract customers in 2012-13, a change from a forecast gain of 919,000. CS sees greater customer turnover among users of Sprint's older network technologies as it upgrades to 4G LTE during the next several years.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • LO

    Lorillard (LO +9.8%) pops after its Q4 easily beat estimates earlier today. Net earnings jumped...

    Lorillard (LO +9.8%) pops after its Q4 easily beat estimates earlier today. Net earnings jumped 20% Y/Y as margins rose on a combination of increased shipments of its Newport and Maverick brands plus higher sales prices. The company also boosted its quarterly dividend by 19%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -17%) sinks to session lows after its surprise Q4 earnings miss, dragging down...

    Groupon (GRPN -17%) sinks to session lows after its surprise Q4 earnings miss, dragging down other tech IPO darlings of 2011: LNKD -0.1%, which is set to report its quarterly results after today's close, ZNGA -4.5%, P -3.7%. Henry Blodget tells Groupon haters to "admit they were wrong about the company's business model," since it is now profitable, but he still wouldn't buy the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • TEX

    Shares of Terex (TEX +4%) creep higher after being upgraded to Buy earlier at Longbow Research,...

    Shares of Terex (TEX +4%) creep higher after being upgraded to Buy earlier at Longbow Research, citing positive crane survey results and improving fundamentals.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • FFNT

    Shares of FriendFinder (FFN +2.4%) keep running after tripling in the past 10 days, and Eric...

    Shares of FriendFinder (FFN +2.4%) keep running after tripling in the past 10 days, and Eric Savitz is at a loss to explain why: "Maybe they started advertising on... Penny Stock Porn Purveyor FriendFinder." On Jan. 25, the company announced a cost-reduction plan that included consolidating offices. That's enough to hike shares from $0.75 to $2.15?
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • PM

    Philip Morris (PM +2.7%) is up today after beating Q4 estimates on both EPS and revenue. Net...

    Philip Morris (PM +2.7%) is up today after beating Q4 estimates on both EPS and revenue. Net profit climbed 7.6% Y/Y as the tobacco company notched strong volume growth in Asia. In its conference call, CEO Louis Camilleri says pricing will be a tailwind for the cigarette maker this year, and it's already initiated price hikes in several key markets, including Germany, Indonesia and Russia. (conference call webcast here)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMSC

    In spite of beating FQ3 forecasts, American Superconductor (AMSC -9.1%) is off sharply, as...

    In spite of beating FQ3 forecasts, American Superconductor (AMSC -9.1%) is off sharply, as investors focus on the company's guidance for Q1 revenue of $27M and a net loss of less than $0.39/share - current consensus is for revenue of $31.3M and EPS of -$0.27. In addition, AMSC noted during its earnings call that it expects a "slightly negative gross margin" for the quarter, due to revenue mix and timing issues.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA -2.6%) is trading down after reporting a Q4 net loss, reversing...

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA -2.6%) is trading down after reporting a Q4 net loss, reversing year-ago gains and missing forecasts. Revenue plummeted 49% Y/Y on lower sales of enoxaparin, a key customer's drug used to treat blocked arteries.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • URBN

    Roth Capital keeps a Buy rating and $33 price target in place on Urban Outfitters (URBN +2.1%)...

    Roth Capital keeps a Buy rating and $33 price target in place on Urban Outfitters (URBN +2.1%) after running a number of positive channel checks and finding the retailer's outlook "compelling."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +4.3%) trades higher after its Q4 beat estimates across the board...

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +4.3%) trades higher after its Q4 beat estimates across the board earlier today. Revenue jumped 45% Y/Y on higher overall net product sales, particularly in its blood disease drug Soliris with new PNH patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • BG

    Bunge (BG +5.3%) posts a solid gain after beating Q4 estimates earlier today. Revenue jumped 29%...

    Bunge (BG +5.3%) posts a solid gain after beating Q4 estimates earlier today. Revenue jumped 29% Y/Y - despite a sharp rise in costs and a decline in oilseed processing and grain trading revenues - as its bottom line was anchored by profits from its expanding sugar business and the contribution of a recently acquired shipping facility in the Ukraine.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • ASTX

    Shares of Astex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ASTX) resume trading down 10.8% off the news that the...

    Shares of Astex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ASTX) resume trading down 10.8% off the news that the FDA rejected the use of Dacogen to treat AML in adults over the age of 65.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • BDC

    Belden (BDC -7%) dips after posting a mixed Q4. Earnings beat on a per share basis, but revenue...

    Belden (BDC -7%) dips after posting a mixed Q4. Earnings beat on a per share basis, but revenue fell short of analysts' expectations. The company also issues weak guidance for the full year, now seeing its EPS around $2.70 - $2.90 per share on revenue of $1.98B - $2.03B.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • NUAN

    Nuance Communications (NUAN +3.8%) surges ahead of its FQ1 report; earnings at the maker of...

    Nuance Communications (NUAN +3.8%) surges ahead of its FQ1 report; earnings at the maker of speech recognition software believed to be used in Apple's Siri voice-command system for mobile phones is expected to rise 29% vs. a year ago. Discussing NUAN, CNBC commentators say the stock is attractive, sparked by Apple TV as a "game changer."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • PACR

    Pacer International (PACR -11.1%) trades lower after its Q4 result misses revenue estimates,...

    Pacer International (PACR -11.1%) trades lower after its Q4 result misses revenue estimates, despite its EPS swinging to a modest profit on higher margins and lower expenses. Net earnings dipped 4% Y/Y however, as the freight transportation company's logistics segment posted a sharp decline in sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • CSOD

    After surging in the wake of Oracle/Taleo, some cloud software names have sold off: CSOD +1.2%....

    After surging in the wake of Oracle/Taleo, some cloud software names have sold off: CSOD +1.2%. CTCT -1%. N -0.2%. Others are faring better: OTCPK:SABA +5.7%. CRM +3%. KNXA +2.4%. Bernstein thinks Oracle's modest premium, perhaps due to a limited number of potential buyers, "puts a cap" on future deal valuations. However, as Nomura notes, the run-up already seen in Taleo due to M&A hopes helps explain the small premium.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • THOR-OLD

    Piper Jaffray weighs in on Thoratec (THOR-OLD +11.2%) by upgrading the shares to Overweight on...

    Piper Jaffray weighs in on Thoratec (THOR-OLD +11.2%) by upgrading the shares to Overweight on its strong earnings report, noting the recent quarter shows surprising unit growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods' (DMND -36.4%) restatements will likely lead it to default on its debt covenants,...

    Diamond Foods' (DMND -36.4%) restatements will likely lead it to default on its debt covenants, analysts believe. Such an event would lead Diamond, which had $531.7M of debt as of July 31, to pay higher interest rates. Nonetheless, KeyBanc (Hold) is playing devil's advocate today, arguing Diamond still has a break-up value of $44/share, and at least $1.80/share in near-term earnings power. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • CLMS

    Calamos Asset Management (CLMS +2.5%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral on valuation at Credit...

    Calamos Asset Management (CLMS +2.5%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral on valuation at Credit Suisse, citing the firms excess capital and high relative fund performance.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • TDC

    Teradata (TDC +8.7%), a provider of soup-to-nuts data warehousing solutions, is surging after...

    Teradata (TDC +8.7%), a provider of soup-to-nuts data warehousing solutions, is surging after beating Q4 estimates and announcing a new $300M stock buyback authorization (raises total available funds to $375M). Teradata is guiding for 2012 revenue growth of 10%-12% and EPS of $2.55-$2.65, in-line with a consensus of 11.2% and $2.60. Informatica (INFA +2.8%) might be rising in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • CE

    Celanese (CE +1.5%) gains after being upgraded to Buy at Jefferies earlier today. Jefferies says...

    Celanese (CE +1.5%) gains after being upgraded to Buy at Jefferies earlier today. Jefferies says H1 risks are already baked into the stock, which makes it a lower-risk way to add cyclical exposure.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM +10%) continues to surge on account of its Q4 beat and healthy top-line guidance -...

    Akamai (AKAM +10%) continues to surge on account of its Q4 beat and healthy top-line guidance - likely proof that its recent price cuts are having an effect. During its earnings call, Akamai noted media & entertainment sales, for which it has faced tough price competition, rose 17% Q/Q. Nonetheless, Akamai's gross margin rose for the first time in 7 quarters, and Wells Fargo believes its margin forecasts are probably conservative.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • IRBT

    Some brokers appear to be playing a game of catch-up with iRobot (IRBT -32%) today, downgrading...

    Some brokers appear to be playing a game of catch-up with iRobot (IRBT -32%) today, downgrading the shares on the back of its disastrous Q4 report after the close yesterday. JP Morgan cuts the shares to Underweight, Morgan Keegan lowers it to Underperform and EarlyBird Capital downgrades it to Hold, all citing weak guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 4 Comments
  • MGM

    Las Vegas Strip gambling revenue jumped 3.6% to $518M in December, with slot machine revenue up...

    Las Vegas Strip gambling revenue jumped 3.6% to $518M in December, with slot machine revenue up 6.4% and table games win up 1.7%. The Strip results "reflect the continued strengthening of trends with volume growth in tables without baccarat and slot," J.P. Morgan says, seeing the trends as positive for MGM +1.3%, LVS +1.6% and WYNN -0.1%. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • CMP

    Compass Minerals (CMP -4.7%) takes a hit after JP Morgan cut the shares to Underweight earlier...

    Compass Minerals (CMP -4.7%) takes a hit after JP Morgan cut the shares to Underweight earlier this morning, noting that historical patterns indicate weak price performance in the years following very warm winters - such as the one we're experiencing right now.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • BB

    Canaccord cuts its 2012 and 2013 financial estimates for Research In Motion (RIMM -2.4%) due to...

    Canaccord cuts its 2012 and 2013 financial estimates for Research In Motion (RIMM -2.4%) due to weak demand for the company’s BlackBerry 7 smartphone lineup despite increased marketing efforts.
